comments: The number 0.121121112... is irrational. - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 05 2000Fixed point of the following mapping w. Suppose x(n) takes values in {1,2} and w(n)=[x(1),x(2),...,x(n)]. Next define w(n+1)=[x(1),x(2),...,x(n),x(n-1)] if x(n)=1 and w(n+1)=[x(1),x(2),...,x(n),x(n-1),x(n-1)] if x(n)=2. Then taking x(1)=1 and x(2)=2 we get w(infinity)=A042974 (i.e., x(n)=A042974(n)). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Jan 11 2013
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
C. V. Eynden, Problem 10439. An irrational mimic of 1/9, Amer. Math. Monthly, 104 (1997), 873.
Index entries for continued fractions for constants
prog: (PARI) {a(n) = 1 + issquare(9 + 8*n)}; /* _Michael Somos_, Jan 12 2000 */(PARI) { default(realprecision, 20080); x=0; for (n=1, 20000, x=10*x + 1 + issquare(9+8*n)); x/=10^19999; for (n=1, 20000, d=floor(x); x=(x-d)*10; write("b042974.txt", n, " ", d)); } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, May 08 2009(Haskell)a042974 n = a042974_list !! (n-1)a042974_list =  1 : 2 :   concat (zipWith replicate (tail a042974_list) a042974_list)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 08 2011
